item.title: Learning TypeScript
item.author: 作者
item.description: Learning TypeScript type & interface type A type alias is exactly that - a name for any type. We can use a type alias to give a name to any type at all, not just an object type. 1 type ID = number | string; But note that, aliases are only aliases. We can’t use type aliases to create different/distinct versions of the same type. Interface An interface declaration is
